analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma tika tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The reverse order of the law of conditionality
The exposition of the conditions in brief

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ navipākaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca anidassanaappaṭigho vipāko dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na vipākam dhammam paṭicca anidassana appaṭighaḥ vipākaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: A resultant, non-visible, impinging, non-inconstant state is conditionally originated from a non-visible, non-impinging, resultant state. (In brief) … From a cause there are three … From an absence of object there are three.

original: Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ navipākadhammadhammaṁ paccayā anidassanaappaṭigho vipākadhammadhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasanidassanasappaṭighaṁ nanevavipākanavipākadhammadhammaṁ paṭicca sanidassanasappaṭigho
analyzed: na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na vipāka dhamma dhammam paccayā anidassana appaṭighaḥ vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  na sa nidassana sa paṭigham na na iva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammam paṭicca sa nidassana sa paṭighaḥ
translated: A resultant, non-visible, impinging, inconstant state is conditionally originated from a non-visible, non-impinging, resultant, inconstant state. (In brief) … From a cause there are three … From an absence of object there are three.

analyzed: neva vipāka na vipāka dhamma dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekavīsa
translated: A non-resultant, non-visible, impinging, inconstant state is conditionally originated from a non-resultant, non-visible, impinging, inconstant state. (In brief) … From a cause there are twenty-one …

original: adhipatiyā ekavīsa …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… avigate ekavīsa.
analyzed: adhipatiyā ekavīsa pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe avigate ekavīsa
translated: From a dominant there are twenty-one … From a mutuality there are three … From an absence of object there are twenty-one.
